main event: Multiple sightings of an elongated, colored object that burned out abruptly in the New Mexico-Texas area on April 16, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of three or four dollars and having six colored lights.
The object moved slowly compared to a meteor and burned out almost abruptly after traveling for about 500 yards.
Multiple sightings of the object were reported from various locations in the region.
The object was observed from the air by a pilot of an F-100 aircraft and from the ground by a civilian in Clovis, New Mexico.
Authorities were unable to definitively identify the object, with various possibilities suggested including a fireball, satellite, or meteor.
